test.title: Test
test.question: Which of the following is a correct example of using Matplotlib with Streamlit?
options: import streamlit as st, import matplotlib.pyplot as plt, import numpy as np, x = np.linspace(0, 10, 100), y = np.sin(x), fig, ax = plt.subplots(), ax.plot(x, y), st.pyplot(fig)
import streamlit as st, import matplotlib.pyplot as plt, x = range(10), y = [i**2 for i in x], st.plot(x, y)
import streamlit as st, import matplotlib.pyplot as plt, x = range(10), y = [i**2 for i in x], st.plotly_chart(plt.plot(x, y))

test.question: Which module is used to create custom components in Streamlit?

test.title: Test
test.question: How do you create a custom HTML component in Streamlit?
options:
import streamlit as st, import streamlit.components.v1 as components, components.html('

Hello, World!

')

import streamlit as st, import streamlit.html as html, html('

Hello, World!

')

import streamlit as st, import streamlit.components.v1 as components, components.markdown('

Hello, World!

')

test.title: Test
test.question: What is Streamlit's Session State used for?
options: To persist data across different runs of the script

test.title: Test
test.question: How do you initialize a counter in Streamlit's Session State?
options: import streamlit as st, if 'counter' not in st.session_state:, st.session_state.counter = 0
import streamlit as st, if 'counter' not in st.session:, st.session.counter = 0
import streamlit as st, if 'counter' not in st.state:, st.state.counter = 0

test.title: Test
test.question: Which function increments a counter in Streamlit's Session State?
options: import streamlit as st, if st.button('Increment'): st.state.counter += 1
import streamlit as st, if st.button('Increment'): st.session.counter += 1
import streamlit as st, if st.button('Increment'): st.session_state.counter += 1

test.title: Test
test.question: How do you create a button in Streamlit that triggers a function when clicked?
options: import streamlit as st, if st.button('Click me'): st.write('Button clicked!')
import streamlit as st, st.button('Click me', on_click=function)
import streamlit as st, st.button('Click me', trigger=function)

options: import streamlit as st, st.sidebar().title('Sidebar Title')
import streamlit as st, st.sidebar.title('Sidebar Title')
import streamlit as st, st.sidebar.header('Sidebar Title')
